body_html:
@ebrevdo I've tried to make to make a smaller fail case, but I can't seem to find a different way to repeat than in the code in my previous comment. Though it does seem as though that the tensors of the encoder are called and evaluated once at the start in the while loop, and the other results are just the previous values without reevaluation.
EDIT: I've read up on while loops, and realized it is not possible to evaluate tensors defined outside of the loop. Due to this I will probably rewrite my model, and then this bug becomes obsolete for my case. Due to the obscure conditions needed for this bug, I'm closing the issue.

body:
@ebrevdo I've tried to make to make a smaller fail case, but I can't seem to find a different way to repeat than in the code in my previous comment. Though it does seem as though that the tensors of the encoder are called and evaluated once at the start in the while loop, and the other results are just the previous values without reevaluation.
EDIT: I've read up on while loops, and realized it is not possible to evaluate tensors defined outside of the loop. Due to this I will probably rewrite my model, and then this bug becomes obsolete for my case. Due to the obscure conditions needed for this bug, I'm closing the issue.
